intro: Dimorphostemon shanxiensis, commonly known as the Shanxi dimorphostemon, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lardizabalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bipinnate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Its botanical features make it an important species for studying plant adaptation in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
